did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: A Guide to the Letter, James W. Keeble to Unidentified, 1861 Mar. 10

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Letter, James W. Keeble to Unidentified, 1861 Mar. 10. Local Government Records Collection. The Library of Virginia, Richmond, VA.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This item came to the Library of Virginia in a transfer of court papers from Essex County (Va.)

bioghist.head: Biographical Information
bioghist.p: James W. Keeble was a schoolteacher from Mathews County, Virginia who took a job as Professor of Tactics at Madison college, Sharow, Mississippi. The 1860 census lists his parents as Humphrey H. and Sarah Keeble.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The Letter, James W. Keeble to Unidentified, consists of three pages, filled front and back, telling an unidentified friend about his new life in Mississippi. Included is mention of a Virginian family named the Montagues and a brief paragraph about the possibility of Virginian secession and Keeble's determination to fight for Virginia.
